column4: how do I get fsck.vfat to correct errors and attempt recovery of bad sectors? It doens't seem to be doing anything, it just exits within like 3 seconds, something about a folder.
if possible, it's much better to fix vfat from within winows
not possible, windows borked a few weeks ago
I assume you are running it as root (the fsck)?
I got it to work and it did what I wanted
ok.  :)
no it didn't, it just claimed it did
I mounted the drive and it was still broked
ok.  there is a flag, -a, that says "automatically fix things"
-r says interactive fix
doc says that, without one of -a, -r, it checks but does not fix
sweet, it was a corrupted directory and I thought I was going to lose the pictures in it, but they randomly showed up in the root of the partition after fsck.vfat got done with it
that's normal, at least for vfat.
or normal once the file system is borked in the first place.
in windows when I have tried the same type of repairs all I get is a bunch of random files, each with code that doesn't mean anything in the order that it is currently assembled
yes, vfat is not very repairable.
in general it can't even figure out which pieces are from the same file
just remember to not let your foot get near the power cable on USB hdds, because unless they are running ext3 or reiser, you are effed the moment you interrupt a big file transfer
yes, that's why I always run only journaling file systems.  reiser has not been reliable for me, but ext3 is reasonably resiliant
sadly though I have to use the hdd on windows computers so I can't put ext on it unless I want to install the IFS drivers on all of them
yes, I know, fact of life.
